com.hcl.domino.keep.dbrequests.pim

Class AdditionalFieldsHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hcl.domino.keep.dbrequests.pim.AdditionalFieldsHelper

  • public class AdditionalFieldsHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    Utility class for APIs to be able to create, read and update a single field
    that contains JSON metadata that the client creates and can consume.
    This utility will facilitate adding, updating and retrieving this JSON.
    The purpose of this functionality is to allow the consumer to create metadata
    without creating potentially conflicting fields on a document. All the JSON
    is stored in 1 document field named $$K_AdditionalFields.
    When a client wants to add this metadata within the body of request, IE
    create or update they add a new JSON Object named AdditionalFields to their
    request Body, for example: AdditionalFields : { “Field1” : “First Field”,
    “Field2” : “Second Field”, “Field3” : “Third Field” }
    That same object is returned when getting the fields from a document.
    For writing AdditionalFields, If the individual API uses
    createDocumentFromPayload or updateDocFromPayload, no intervention is
    necessary as long as the AdditionalFields object is in the incoming.
    For reading a document’s fields, no work needs to be done to create the
    AdditionalFields object if the API is calling document2Json.
    If the API does not use one of those functions, they can use this helper to
    get add or update the document.
    What this helper does is add or update a Text field to the document, that
    text field is named : $$K_AdditionalFields This field contains the JSON of
    the Object minus the object name, IE: { “Field1” : “First Field”, “Field2”
    “Second Field”, “Field3” : “Third Field” }
    If the document being updated already has a the $$K_AdditionalFields field
    and the request contains an AdditionalFields JSON Object, new key/values will
    be appended to the existing $$K_AdditionalFields while existing keys will
    have their value overwritten.
    When getting the fields from a document, the $$K_AdditionalFields field
    should never be returned, instead the client should return a JSON object
    named AdditionalFields with the contents of that field, IE: AdditionalFields
    { “Field1” : “First Field”, “Field2” : “Second Field”, “Field3” : “Third Field” } By maintaining the same name throughout, the adding, getting and setting of fields will be consistent and it makes this functionality easier to read and understand.
